decision_conditions:
<p>Prior to commencement of works on the relevant part of the building,
details, including detailed cross sections to a scale of 1:20 and a planting and
maintenance scheme, of the construction of the roof areas of basement level
accommodation to the rear of the property not sited below the existing
dwelling shall be submitted to, and approved in writing by, the Local Planning
Authority prior to the commencement of works. The submitted details shall
include allowance for a bio-diverse, substrate-based extensive green roof with
a minimum depth of 1m to allow for planting of the garden areas. The
development shall thereafter be carried out strictly in accordance with the
approved details and maintained in perpetuity.
</p><p>REASON: In the interest of providing external amenity space of an adequately
high standard, enhancing the character and biodiversity value of the
development, promoting sustainable urban drainage and ensuring that the
external appearance of the development is satisfactory and preserves or
enhances the character and appearance of the Stoke Newington Conservation
Area</p>

<p>The development shall not commence until details of all external joinery,
windows and doors, including sections at a scale of 1:20 and samples, have
been submitted to the Local Planning Authority and approved in writing. The
development shall not be carried out otherwise than in accordance with the
details thus approved, and shall be maintained as such thereafter.</p><p>REASON: To ensure that the external appearance of the development is
satisfactory, and preserves or enhances the character and appearance of the
Stoke Newington Conservation Area.</p>

<p>The development shall not commence until details, including samples, of all
materials to be used on the external surfaces of the building, including a
sample panel of the proposed brickwork, and hard surfacing materials, have
been submitted to the Local Planning Authority and approved in writing. The
details submitted shall include, inter alia, elevational and sectional drawings to
a scale of 1:20 of the parapet coping, cornice and shop fronts, the junction of
the new build element of the scheme and the original buildings fronting onto
Stoke Newington High Street and all screens and Juliet balcony types. The
development shall not be carried out otherwise than in accordance with the
details thus approved, and shall be maintained as such thereafter.
</p><p>REASON: To ensure that the external appearance of the development is
satisfactory, and preserves or enhances the character and appearance of the
Stoke Newington Conservation Area.</p>

<p>The Development hereby permitted shall only be carried out and completed
strictly in accordance with the submitted plans hereby approved and any
subsequent approval of details.
</p><p>REASON: To ensure that the development hereby permitted is carried out in
full accordance with the plans hereby approved.<br></p>

<p>The playing of amplified or live music within the basement and ground floor levels hereby permitted is prohibited between the hours of 22:00 and 08:00 on any day.&nbsp;</p><p>REASON: To ensure that the use is operated in a satisfactory manner and does not unduly disturb adjoining occupiers or prejudice local amenity generally.</p>

<p>Prior to occupation of the development hereby permitted, details of secure,
accessible, on site bicycle storage facilities, including layout, stand type and
spacing, and waste storage, of which 50% of each must be allocated for refuse
and 50% for recyclables, compliant with the requirements of the London Plan
2016 and the London Borough of Hackney Refuse and Recycling Storage
Guidance (A guide for planners and architects), showing the provision of
commercial and residential bicycle and waste (refuse and recyclables) to be
provided separately, shall be submitted to, and approved in writing by, the
local planning authority.
</p><p>Such details as approved shall be implemented prior to the first occupation of
the development and shall thereafter be retained and maintained.
</p><p>REASON: to ensure adequate storage for refuse/recycling and bicycles and
reduce reliance on private motor vehicles in the interest of safeguarding
highway safety, ensure an adequately high quality to the external appearance
of the development, and preserve or enhance the character and appearance of
the Stoke Newington Conservation Area.</p>

<p>Before commencement of the ground works, a desk study, site
reconnaissance researches and physical site investigation work shall be
undertaken and fully reported on, with a suitably detailed remedial action plan
produced, and all documentation and information shall be submitted to, and
be approved by, the Local Planning Authority in writing.
</p><p>Development shall not commence until all pre-development remedial actions,
set out within the approved remedial action plan, are complete and a
corresponding pre-development verification report has been submitted to, and
approved by, the Local Planning Authority in writing.
</p><p>Work shall be completed and reporting produced by a competent
person/company in line with current best practice guidance, including the
Local Planning Authority's contaminated land guidance. The Developer shall
provide the Local Planning Authority with written notification at least five days
before investigation and remediation works commence. This condition may be
varied or discharged in agreed phases.
</p><p>REASON: In the interests of protecting the natural environment and human
health from any harmful contamination-related impacts.</p>

<p>Prior to the first occupation of the development hereby approved a
minimum of 4 swift nesting bricks and 4 bat boxes shall be provided at or
close to eaves level of the development hereby approved. The bricks/boxes
shall be retained thereafter in perpetuity.
</p><p>REASON: in the interests of biodiversity.</p>

<p>Above ground works shall not commence until a detailed surface water
drainage scheme for the development, based on sustainable drainage
principles, has been submitted to and approved in writing by the Local
Planning Authority. The details shall include, inter alia, a long term
management and maintenance plan for the SUDS included in the approved
scheme.
</p><p>The scheme shall subsequently be implemented in accordance with the
approved details before the development is completed and shall thereafter be
retained and maintained, unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local
Planning Authority.
</p><p>REASON: In the interests of prevention of exacerbation of surface water flood
risk to adjoining land.</p>

<p>No development shall occur until a Construction Logistics and Traffic
Management Plan (CLTMP) has been submitted to and approved in writing by
the Local Planning Authority in conjunction with Transport for London and the
Council's Traffic and Transport Team. The CLTMP shall include a full
construction traffic impact assessment, details of the construction traffic route
and a construction traffic management plan to include details of the following:
</p><p>(a) loading and unloading of plant and materials;</p><p>(b) storage of plant and materials;
</p><p>(c) programme of works (including measures for traffic management); and
</p><p>(d) provision of boundary hoarding behind any visibility zones.
</p><p>The construction should thereafter take place in accordance with the
measures identified within the approved documents.
</p><p>REASON: In order to ensure that the development does not prejudice highway
safety and to ensure the proper management of construction traffic in the
interests of highways safety and the amenity of the area.&nbsp;</p>

<p>All non-Combined Heat and Power space and hot water fossil fuel (or
equivalent hydrocarbon based fuel) boilers must achieve dry NOx emission
levels equivalent to or less than 40 mg/kWh.
</p><p>REASON: To protect air quality and human health by ensuring that the
production of air pollutants are kept to a minimum during the course of
building works and during the lifetime of the development.</p>

<p>The access to the south of the site from Stoke Newington High Street shall
be made and kept available for use by occupiers of the development for
pedestrian and bicycle access at all times.
</p><p>REASON: to safeguard an adequate quality of access to the development and
reduce reliance on private motor vehicles.</p>

<p>The commercial uses falling within use Class E(a), (b), (c), (e), (f) and (g) hereby permitted may only be carried out between
0800 hours and 2200 hours Mondays to Saturdays (inclusive) and 0800 hours
and 1800 hours on Sundays, Public and Bank Holidays.
</p><p>REASON: To ensure that the uses are operated in a satisfactory manner and
do not unduly disturb adjoining occupiers or prejudice local amenity generally.</p>

<p>Prior to the occupation of unit 3, a sample of obscure glazing for the first
floor window to the east elevation to unit 3 shall be submitted to, and
approved in writing by, the local planning authority. The window shall be
constructed entirely from the approved obscure glazing and fixed shut prior to
occupation of this unit and maintained as such thereafter.
</p><p>REASON: to safeguard the residential amenity of neighbouring properties.</p>

<p>Prior to occupation of the residential accommodation hereby permitted, a
sample of obscure screening shall be submitted to, and approved in writing
by, the local planning authority. An obscure privacy fence constructed entirely
from the approved obscure screening (with the exception of any necessary
supports which shall themselves be constructed of an opaque material) of 1.8
metres in height from the finished floor level of the podium at first floor along
the whole of the north boundary of the external rear areas at first floor level
shall be constructed prior to the occupation of the residential accommodation
provided by the development and permanently retained thereafter .
</p><p>REASON: To safeguard the residential amenity of future occupiers of the
development and neighbouring properties.&nbsp;</p>

<p>No soil stacks, soil vent pipes, flues, ductwork or any other pipework shall
be fixed to the elevations of the building other than as shown on the drawings
hereby approved.
</p><p>REASON: To ensure that the external appearance of the building is
satisfactory, and preserves or enhances the character and appearance of the
Stoke Newington Conservation Area.</p>

<p>The development hereby permitted must be begun not later than 05/02/2023.</p><p>REASON: In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country
Planning Act 1990 as amended.</p>
description: Variation of condition 9 (operating hours) attached to planning permission 2018/4018 granted 05/02/2020. The effect of the variation would allow unrestricted operating hours for the basement and ground floor commercial uses.
